summary: The Affordable Housing Credit Improvement Act of 2025 proposes significant reforms to the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) program. The bill aims to increase state allocations, modify tenant eligibility rules (including addressing student occupancy and domestic abuse), clarify credit eligibility, and address issues related to rural and Native American housing. It also includes provisions concerning exempt facility bonds, data transparency, and encourages the removal of discriminatory land use policies. The bill modifies rules surrounding casualty losses, ownership rules, and eligible basis calculations.
